title: Top-Rated Kimberley Apartment Stay with Room Upgrade & Welcome Wine
description:
Enjoy an outback escape in a self-contained apartment at Freshwater East Kimberley Apartments, offering top-rated accommodation and a beautiful resort-style pool. Located just south of Kununurra - between the coast and Purnululu National Park, home to the legendary Bungle Bungle Range - these contemporary apartments reflect the beauty of the Western Australian landscape through the use of Kimberley stone and large outdoor spaces.

Browse the surrounding Indigenous art galleries, jewellers and sandalwood craft shops, stopping for a taste of the region's flavours at a café or pub, then venture to Kununurra's surrounding waters and wetlands for some watersport fun. Head deep into the rugged wilderness to explore the striking landscapes of the outback or capture the best sunset in Western Australia at Kelly’s Knob.

title: El Questro Safari-Style Outback Retreat with Daily Gourmet Dining & Wilderness Park Permits
description:
Stay among some of Australia’s most spectacular landscapes at the Kimberley’s Emma Gorge Resort at El Questro, the perfect launchpad into the natural wonders of El Questro Wilderness Park. Sleep in a spacious tented ensuite cabin, surrounded by local wildlife, ancient boab trees and the tawny sandstone cliffs of the Cockburn Range. You’re ideally placed to explore the sights: discover the famous Emma Gorge Trail, Zebedee Springs and countless waterfalls, swimming holes and hiking routes.

The resort has everything you need for a comfortable stay without sacrificing an authentic wilderness experience. After a day of hiking and outdoor activities, relax on the sprawling lawns or take a dip in the turquoise swimming pool to escape the Kimberley heat. And when you're feeling peckish, dine under the stars at Emma’s Restaurant.

**Your handpicked inclusions:**

- Wake up each morning to a delicious daily breakfast at Emma’s Restaurant
- Every evening is a memorable one with nightly two-course set menu dinner at Emma’s Restaurant
- Explore the beauty of El Questro Wilderness Park with included park permits
- Enjoy the ease of roundtrip airport transfers as per the resort's schedule (see the Fine Print for details)

**This deal has NO peak surcharges:** Travel any time for the same great price.
offer_address: 1 Gibb River- Wyndham Road, Durack 6743, Western Australia

title: Award-Winning Kimberley Apartment Escape for up to Four Guests
description:
Enjoy a sun-soaked escape in a self-contained apartment at Freshwater East Kimberley Apartments, offering award-winning accommodation together with a beautiful resort-style pool. Located just south of Kununurra - between the coast and Purnululu National Park, home to the legendary Bungle Bungle Range - these contemporary apartments reflect the beauty of the Kimberley landscape with its use of Kimberley stone and large outdoor spaces.

The perfect accommodation for staging your adventure in the Kimberley, your escape includes a guaranteed room upgrade and a bottle of Margaret River wine on arrival.

**Travelling with family or a group?** Upgrade to the spacious Two-Bedroom Apartment, valid for four people.

title: Kimberley Outback Glamping near Emma Gorge with Daily Breakfast & A$100 Dining Credit
description:
Delve into some of Australia’s most breathtaking scenery at this secluded retreat, nestled among the Eastern Kimberley’s natural wonders. El Questro Emma Gorge Resort is the perfect launchpad into the stunning landscapes of El Questro Wilderness Park. The resort has everything you need for a comfortable stay without sacrificing an authentic wilderness experience.

Sleep in a spacious tented ensuite cabin, surrounded by local wildlife, ancient boab trees and the tawny sandstone cliffs of the Cockburn Range. When you're feeling peckish, dine under the stars at Emma’s Restaurant.

You’ll be ideally placed to traverse the sights: discover the iconic Emma Gorge Trail, accessible directly from the resort, or book a tour to unwind in the thermal waters of Zebedee Springs and uncover countless waterfalls, crystal-clear swimming holes and scenic hiking trails. After a day of exploring and outdoor activities, relax on the sprawling lawns or take a dip in the turquoise swimming pool to escape the Kimberley heat.
offer_address: 1 Gibb River- Wyndham Road, Durack 6743, Western Australia

title: All-Inclusive Luxury on the Kimberley Coast
description: Be one of the privileged few to lay eyes upon the breathtaking Kimberley Region in WA. Stay in award-winning luxury at the one-of-a-kind Berkeley River Lodge and enjoy an all-inclusive five-night stay in a private villa. Includes all meals - gourmet breakfast, lunch and nightly five-course degustation dinner - unlimited beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic), daily excursions, return charter plane transfers from Darwin and more for two.

title: Unforgettable All-Inclusive Kimberley Outback Experience with Scenic Helicopter Flight
description:
It would be remiss to label Bullo River Station as simply an accommodation option in the Kimberley - it’s a one-of-a-kind experience that will stay with you long after you’ve left its remote location. On the edge of the East Kimberley region in Australia’s Northern Territory, the luxury working cattle station and homestead sits on half a million acres of pristine outback, encompassing gorges, waterfalls and the Victoria and Bullo rivers. The front gate is 50km from the homestead and the closest neighbours are three hours away - this is the true Australian outback.

Spend your days riding horses through gorges, cruising the Bullo river, looking out for wildlife and admiring the station from above with a helicopter ride. Swim in billabongs, picnic by waterfalls and learn more about the ancient Miriuwung-Gajerrong culture by exploring traditional rock art sites. Don't miss the exclusive helicopter touring experience to Victoria River Lookout. Perched high on a rocky outcrop, overlooking Victoria River, awe-inspiring doesn’t do this location justice. Wake early and experience it at sunrise or spend a romantic evening admiring the view at sunset with a platter and drinks.

After adventurous days, retire to your purpose-built, air-conditioned ensuite room, laze by the homestead pool, or take your pick of hammocks among the palm trees. Meals are a communal affair - breakfast is served on the veranda and dinners celebrate the bevvy of beautiful ingredients found on the station, including organic prime beef and barramundi (that you may have even caught yourself!). Lunch is incorporated into your daily activity, with fresh treats packed by the team.
offer_address: 9870 Victoria Highway, Baines, Northern Territory 0852 Australia
